name: Hotel on St Georges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incredible value. The hotel is central. This means you take care after dark and when quiet such as on Sundays. Taxis recommended for the Waterfront at night. They offer modest priced evening meals and the breakfasts are generous. They do not cook bacon crispy but the rest of the wide variation of food is fine. The restaurant is in the basement but the lighting is bright. The staff were helpful. The bulk of the guests are business people in the week and coach loads of overseas visitors in the weekends.
reviews.title: It is good
Superb service and value for money
reviews.text: I like the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 9 nights in March and had a wonderful stay. The room was modern and well equipped. The breakfast, which was included in the price, was fantastic. The staff were very efficient and helpful. The hotels location is only a short cab ride from the V&A waterfront which was OK by me as it was so prentious down there. An ideal base for getting around Cape Town and not far from excellent restuarants.
reviews.title: Well placed hotel

likes.liked: — The general feeling of well being & looked after by staff keen to serve

reviews.text: Booked blind by Travel Agent. Good clean four star city centre hotel. Good friendly staff. In daylight easy walk to V & A Waterfront, but taxis cheap and always available. Large shopping centre/mall over road.
reviews.title: Loved It!!!

reviews.text: My Brother and I stayed at the St. George in Early November this year. My brother is very ill and we wanted to have a fantastic holiday together and our stay at the St. George Hotel was fantastic. The staff were great, could not be more helpful. The rooms were excellent all in all I cannot find one negative thing to say about our 8 day stay apart from it was not long enough. I will return to Cape Town soon I hope and I certainly will be staying at the St.George Hotel. Thank you for making it a wonderfully memorable stay.
reviews.title: Fabulous Service !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a South African living abroad and visiting my home country for the first time in 3 years I decided to book a cheap hotel in order to spend money on other stuff like trips to the fabulous Cape Town restaurants, local tours, shopping, wines, etc. I found my stay at the George's so-so. After reading the other reviews and realizing that it is indeed good (if not great!) value for money, I decided to book for a 5-night stay during the end of July '06. The hotel seriously needs a face lift! The interior is quite 80's and everything needs a good dusting. We checked in at 23h00 after a long flight and found the staff all scrambling around when we arrived. There was no drink service in the bar, so they offered to buy us some bottles of water. Good service. Staff was overall a bit "absent" and not really perked up when you asked a question at the reception desk. A brochure in the hotel room stated that there was a gym in the building (I knew that there wasn't from the Expedia hotel description, but still wanted to check) and when I asked reception, they seemed dumbfounded. Apparently the hotel had a gym.. like 10 years ago! Doesn't anyone check the brochures to see whether they are up-to-date? Hotel room was clean, but dark and no windows could open. The light in the bathroom kept on flickering and after calling the front desk they offered to repair same the next day (they did). Breakfast was good - you could really fill up for a long day of activity ahead. Fruit juices were just gross (powered stuff).
reviews.title: OK value for money, but needs a make-over, fast!

likes.disliked: — Outdated interior, unfazed staff, unsafe downtown Cape Town location

reviews.text: If you on a tight budget, then book the hotel. If you're not - stay somewhere else (City Lodge in the Waterfront is great too). One tip: in the same building where the hotel is located (ABSA building) is a great restaurant called Antique and an adjacent bar, Butterfly Bar, located on the 33rd floor. You need to take the elevator and will be escorted by a doorman. Very posh, hip and full of Cape Town's beautiful. It has the most beautiful view of Cape Town at night!
reviews.title: They overcharged me by $10,000!

reviews.text: 21 people from my organization stayed at the St-George last September for 4 nights and used the hotel's conference room facilities for 3 days. The hotel was nice and the staff was friendly. However they completely messed up the billing. Now 10 months later the hotel has overcharges my credit card twice by $10,000 which was the total amount I paid. They claimed we did not pay. I have put in 3 complaints with AMEX and AMEX has agreed with me each time. The hotel now refuses to answer my calls and just charged my card AGAIN. AMEX can't stop them from charging my card but keeps on refunding me. I do not recommend this hotel for large groups. They just don't know how to handle this.
reviews.title: St George's is a steal for the quality offered

reviews.text: About our trip: We stayed at the St. Georges for 3 nights at the end of April. We booked through Air Canada on their website (same rate as Expedia) and got an excellent rate at 75CAN$ including full (cold and hot) breakfast. Although I got scared by the "Terryfying death trap review" and that, AFTER booking it, everything was fine. I was amazed we could get an apparently 4 star hotel in Cape Town for so little money. I'll divide my review in parts so it's easier to read. We were traveling to South Africa for leisure.
reviews.title: good for the money
Terrifying Death Trap
reviews.text: CHECK-IN: Our flight arrived from London early in the morning so we weren't sure If they would give us our room right away since after travelling nearly non-stop from North America, we were exhausted. Got to the hotel a little before 9 a.m. We were offered help to unload our luggage but declined. Seems though that the "porter" (I think he doubles as a Concierge) is not always available on the spot. The Front desk was relatively quiet and the lady had no problems finding our reservation. During our stay, we found that she was one of the friendliest and best staff members on duty there. I believe her name was Sylvia but I'm not sure. We chatted a bit with her on the dead Sunday night and she was a sweetheart. Anyways, to my surprise, she gave us our room right away and just what we had requested, a double non-smoking room. Our non-smoking room had an ashtray (!) with a big X on it. I found that amusing and please be advised that even though they are non-smoking signs on the doors as well as on the elevator landing ("Non-smoking floor"), that didn't stop our room neighbors from ligthing up. Expedia/Hotels customers don't seem to be treated differently from other guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a perfectly good stay at the St Georges Hotel in July. The location was excellent for discovering the city centre and doing all that shopping and musum visiting. Taxis are abundant and we always felt safe.
reviews.title: A good value choice for the city centre

likes.disliked: — old bath tubs and no free internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is clean and the service good. Sure it is a little old (certainly not 4 star) and the bathrooms do need some modernisation. The hot water could have been hotter and the internet ought to have been free, but the hearty breakfasts more than made up for these shortcomings!
reviews.title: Friendly staff, good value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are not equipped with fridges and the 'free' soaps etc are rather disappointing. However, the price was excellent value and certainly a good city centre choice for a few days.
reviews.title: Hotel has some problems!

likes.liked: — food and some staff were very very helpful
likes.disliked: — some reception staff were very unhelpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel and it was bargain price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed the first week in June and had a good sized room with great views of table mountain.
reviews.title: Needs a re-furb
extremely good value for (our) money
reviews.text: We stayed at the St Georges last week. We booked online with a big online operator and had extremely good rates.

reviews.title: Perfect!
reviews.text: We were given a gigantic corner room on the 12th floor with views over the Table Mountain, free safe at reception, ovenight valet parking for a few pounds a day and an excellent and abundant English and continental breakfast. The room was very clean and when we had a small problem with a socket that would not work, it was fixed within 15 minutes.
all members of staff very very friendly and helpful as well as professional.
reviews.title: This is so weird - they did the same with us!!!

reviews.text: Location gives easy access to the airport, the waterfront, the botanic gardens, the wine region and the cape point, as well as the historical part of Cape Town.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel
Safe and Central
reviews.text: Definitely one of the best deals we found on the net!

description: The Hotel on St. George’s is conveniently located on the foreshore, the major hub of Cape Town’s legal, financial and publishing district. This location enjoys the convenience of being a few minutes’ walk from Cape Town CBD, Cape Town International Convention Centre and the world renowned V&A Waterfront and 22 kilometers from Cape Town International Airport. The Hotel offers affordable accommodation combined with conference facilities backed by a professional and dedicated team.
